title: Gladhouse Reservoir Walking Route

images.title: Walter Baxter / Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gladhouse Reservoir, built in the 1870s, is a public water supply reservoir for Edinburgh, and with an area of 168 hectares, it is the largest body of fresh water in the Lothians. The reservoir is a Site of Special Scientific Interest (SSSI) and during the winter months it is a roosting area for pink-footed geese. This is a view from the nearby Torfichen Hill.

images.title: Jim Barton / Spillway at Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Spillway at Gladhouse Reservoir The solid stonework is characteristic of waterworks, built to last.

images.title: Richard Webb / Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Gladhouse Reservoir. Famed wintering ground for ducks and fishery. A matured reservoir at the foot of the Moorfoot Hills.

images.title: Richard Webb / Gladhouse reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The eastern arm of this long established reservoir on the South Esk.

images.title: Gordon Brown / Calm waters at Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Calm waters at Gladhouse Reservoir. These rowing boats await the fishermen, for whom there is a pontoon landing-stage in case the water level changes.

images.title: Jim Barton / NE arm of Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: NE arm of Gladhouse Reservoir. Taken from the boathouse on the shore of the NE arm of the reservoir; a thin skin of ice remains with the spell of cold weather continuing.

images.title: Kirsty Smith / Old Limekiln near Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Old Limekiln near Gladhouse Reservoir

images.title: Sandy Gemmill / The Outflow or Spillway from Gladhouse Reservoir, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The Outflow from Gladhouse Reservoir, as viewed from the eastern end of the dam. In this view the reservoir is full and each wave carries some water over the metal rail at the top of the weir. The water then runs under the road and falls into a deep ravine and down to the nearby Rosebery Reservoir.

description: Enjoy a circular walk around this pretty reservoir near Penicuik. The route runs for a distance of about 5 miles, following a series of country lanes and footpaths around the water. The large reservoir was built in the 1870s, and is a public water supply reservoir for Edinburgh. With an area of 168 hectares, it is the largest body of fresh water in the Lothians. Start the walk from the roadside parking at the south western end of the reservoir. From here you can pick up country lanes to take you around the water. Just to the north is Rosebery Reservoir which is another popular fishing spot in the Lammermuir Hills. To continue your walking in the Pentland Hills head north to the Flotterstone visitor centre and try our circular walk around Glencorse Reservoir. Near here there's more nice waterside footpaths around Harlaw Reservoir and Threipmuir Reservoir .
